newsitem.title: USA: Toro Q3 helped by snow-equipment shipments.
newsitem.headline: Toro Q3 helped by snow-equipment shipments.

text.p: Toro Co said Tuesday its sales and earnings for the third quarter ended August 2 were helped by early shipments of snow-removal equipment.
Earlier, Toro reported better-than-expected third-quarter earnings of $0.52 a share, up from $0.32 in the same quarter of 1995. Net revenue climbed to $232.6 million from $202.6 million.
Toro said consumer product sales rose 33.9 percent to $102.3 million from $76.4 million.
Sales of snowthrowers before the beginning of the snow season in North America and a good performance by Toro's riding and electric products group were mostly responsible for the increase, it said.
Commercial product sales rose about three percent to $84.8 million from $82.4 million.
International sales were strong, and the domestic landscape contractor market continued to grow.
Irrigation sales rose 3.7 percent to $45.4 million from $43.8 million.
"We expect to meet our targets for the year," Kendrick Melrose, Toro's chairman, said in a statement.
